What Creates Sales Tax Nexus in Harlem?

Harlem follows the nexus rules as set out by Georgia sales tax law. It doesn’t have any nexus rules outside of the state law.

Read More: Check out our detailed guide on Sales Tax in Georgia.

Georgia sales tax nexus rules include:

Physical Nexus: If you have an office, warehouse, or any other place of business.

Economic Nexus: If you have gross sales exceeding $100,000 or 200 or more retail transactions in the state in the previous or current calendar year.

Trade Shows: If you participate in trade shows for more than 5 days in a period of 12 months and have sales of more than $100,000.

Employee Location: If you have employees, contractors, salespeople, installers, other personnel, or a third-party affiliate in the state.

What Products Are Exempt from Harlem Sales Tax?

Georgia sales tax law grants the following tax exemptions, which are valid in Harlem:

Objects of art and of anthropological, archeological, geological, horticultural value as well as zoological objects or similar tangible personal property.

Sales of water delivered through water mains, lines, or pipes.

Sales of tangible personal property manufactured or assembled in Georgia for export.

Sales or use of prescription drugs that are lawfully dispensable for the treatment of natural persons

Insulin syringes and blood glucose level measuring strips dispensed without a prescription.

Rental of videotape or film to persons charging admission fees to view the tape or film.

Food stamps or WIC coupons are used as the payment method.

There are no additional exemptions unique to Harlem taxpayers.

Who Needs a Sales Permit in Harlem?

Anyone who plans to sell taxable goods and services in Harlem or anywhere in Georgia needs to get a sales permit.

You can register for a Georgia seller's permit online at the Georgia Department of Revenue.

How to Collect Sales Tax in Harlem

Georgia is a ‘destination-based’ sales tax sourcing state.

What does this mean?

When you make a taxable sale to a customer in Georgia, you should charge the combined sales tax rate at the buyer’s ship-to address.

For instance, you have a business located in Harlem, Georgia, and sell to a customer in Metter. Then, you’ll have to charge the customer the Metter sales tax rate.

Learn more about origin-based and destination-based sales tax sourcing here.

How to File and Pay Sales Tax in Harlem

You have multiple options to file and pay Harlem sales tax returns:

File and pay online: File and pay online at the Georgia Tax Center. You are required to file online if you owe more than $500.

File and pay by mail: Fill out Sales and Use Tax Returns and Addendums (Form ST-3) and mail in your payment.
